article_title: Electric Vehicles Sell Power Back to the Grid
article_text:
In the 1990s, Willett Kempton, a professor at the University of Delaware, proposed in a paper that electric vehicles could help pay for themselves by selling power back to the grid. When no one jumped on the idea, he decided to develop the technology himself.

Now, the pilot project he spearheaded at the university in conjunction with power-plant operator NRG Energy Inc. brings in roughly $110 a month per electric vehicle. The operation uses software to link a minimum of nine electric vehicles, mostly Mini Coopers,...

twitter.description: The fleet of cars serves as a sort of bank for electricity, with the grid operator making deposits and withdrawals as needed.
twitter.title: Electric Vehicles Sell Power Back to the Grid

image.alt: Electric vehicles sell power back to the grid

article_summary:
The operation uses software to link a minimum of nine electric vehicles, mostly Mini Coopers,...
In the 1990s, Willett Kempton, a professor at the University of Delaware, proposed in a paper that electric vehicles could help pay for themselves by selling power back to the grid.
Now, the pilot project he spearheaded at the university in conjunction with power-plant operator NRG Energy Inc. brings in roughly $110 a month per electric vehicle.
When no one jumped on the idea, he decided to develop the technology himself.
